definition: theatrical work (play, opera, TV series etc)/dramatic (change, increase etc)/acute/severe

sentences.english: If you are unaware of the identity of "Lady Stoneheart, " read on at your own risk.
sentences.chinese: 如果你不知道石心夫人是誰，你可能會被劇透。

sentences.english: People hate spoilers, especially when they reveal the endings of a whodunnit.
sentences.chinese: 人們討厭劇透，尤其是偵探懸疑小說的結局。

sentences.english: DiMartino: I don’t want to give anything away, but rest assured there’s a definite link between the old series and this one.
sentences.chinese: 我不想劇透誒，不過新老劇之間肯定有一定聯繫的。

sentences.english: But subjects enjoyed the spoiled version more than the original.
sentences.chinese: 但相比起原版，實驗對象更喜歡含有劇透的版本。

sentences.english: You can experience the latest grave-robbing&horror television fiction of 2015 in advance.
sentences.chinese: 提前體驗，劇透2015最新最火盜墓恐怖影視小說。

definition: dialogue (in a movie or a play)
nonsense/rubbish/superfluous words/You don't say!/No kidding! (gently sarcastic)
It is said that ... (at the start of a narrative)/to discuss/to recount
to plagiarize/to copy/to attack the flank or rear of an enemy
don't tell me .../could it be that...?
"sensational headline writers", people who write misleading titles in order to generate clicks from Internet users/clickbait
to talk drivel/to make irresponsible remarks
